alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 10:06PM EST until January 12 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... White River, Wabash River .Upwards of two inches of rainfall this past weekend put several rivers across central and southern Indiana into flood. Minor flooding is expected to continue on the lower Wabash River through this weekend...and on the lower White River through early next week. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins to flood several Pike County roads. Many of the following county roads begin to flood around this level...east of SR 57 include CR 750N...CR 600N and CR 1000E. Pike county road subject to flooding west of SR 57 include...CR 250 W...CR 400W...CR 675N...CR 700 N...CR 1000w...CR 900W...CR 700W and CR 775W. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Friday /8:30 PM CST Friday/ the stage was 18.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM EST Friday /8:30 PM CST Friday/ was 19.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 16.8 feet and then begin rising early Monday morning. It will then rise again to 16.9 feet Monday morning. It will fall to 16.8 feet and then begin rising early Monday afternoon. It will then rise again to 17.0 feet Tuesday morning. It will fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Saturday afternoon by around 1200 PM CST /100 PM EST/.
